Grain.Do: Barley (1/2 cup cooked), Millet (1/2 cup cooked), Rye (1/2 cup cooked). Focus on lighter, drier grains. Cook with minimal water.
Grain.Dont: Wheat (especially refined), Rice (especially white), Oats. Heavy, sticky grains increase Kapha.

Legume.Do: Mung beans (1/2 cup cooked), Lentils (red or yellow, 1/2 cup cooked). Lightly spiced and well-cooked.
Legume.Dont: Heavy beans like black beans, kidney beans, chickpeas. Avoid fried legumes.

Veg.Do: Bitter and astringent vegetables like bitter gourd (1 cup cooked), leafy greens (see below), cauliflower (1 cup cooked), broccoli (1 cup cooked), asparagus (1 cup cooked). Steamed or lightly sautéed.
Veg.Dont: Sweet, heavy, and watery vegetables like potatoes, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, zucchini. Avoid fried vegetables.

Spices.Do: Warming and pungent spices like ginger (1/2 tsp fresh or 1/4 tsp dry), black pepper (pinch), cinnamon (1/4 tsp), turmeric (1/4 tsp), cardamom (pinch), mustard seeds (1/4 tsp).
Spices.Dont: Excessive salt, sweet spices like nutmeg in large quantities. Cold spices like coriander.

Leafy veg.Do: Spinach (1 cup cooked), kale (1 cup cooked), arugula (1 cup cooked). Lightly steamed or sautéed.

Oil.Do: Mustard oil (1 tsp), olive oil (1 tsp). Used sparingly for sautéing.
Oil.Dont: Excessive amounts of any oil, especially heavy ones like coconut oil or sesame oil (used sparingly).

Fruits.Do: Pungent, bitter, and astringent fruits like apples (1 small), pears (1 small), berries (1/2 cup), pomegranate (1/2 cup). Best eaten earlier in the day.
Fruits.Dont: Sweet and heavy fruits like bananas, mangoes, avocados, melons. Avoid fruits with heavy dairy.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Almonds (4-5 blanched and soaked), walnuts (2-3). In small quantities, as a garnish or light snack.
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Cashews, pistachios, large quantities of any nuts. They are too heavy and oily for Kapha.

Milk product.Do: Low-fat, buttermilk (1 cup, well-spiced), goat milk (1 cup, warm).
Milk product.Dont: Full-fat milk, cheese, yogurt, ice cream. These are heavy, cold, and mucous-forming. If consuming yogurt, ensure it's light and consumed in moderation and not at night.

Condiments.Do: Ginger-lemon water (warm), herb teas (ginger, cinnamon, cardamom), lemon juice.
Condiments.Dont: Sugary drinks, heavy sauces, processed condiments.
